pullrequest.title: move genomedata import to the entry point of signal_distribution

content.raw: It's worth noting that the only place an external import is done is inside `gmtk_parameters.py` and the only function used is a static method, `save_plot` of `SignalStats`.
content.html: It's worth noting that the only place an external import is done is inside gmtk_parameters.py and the only function used is a static method, save_plot of SignalStats.

pullrequest.title: move genomedata import to the entry point of signal_distribution

content.raw: After searching the code I cannot find another instance of `save_plot` from `SignalStats` being used other than those two files. Since it's a static method, and it seems to be used equally between both modules, why not just put the definition inside `gmtk_parameters.py` instead and import it into `signal_distribution.py`?
content.html: After searching the code I cannot find another instance of save_plot from SignalStats being used other than those two files. Since it's a static method, and it seems to be used equally between both modules, why not just put the definition inside gmtk_parameters.py instead and import it into signal_distribution.py?

pullrequest.title: move genomedata import to the entry point of signal_distribution

content.raw:
The `save_plot` method plots signal statistics and `gmtk_parameters.py` is just collecting the parameters and call utility plot functions from other modules to outputs two different plots so I think it is fair to leave `save_plot` in `SignalStats`. Also as long as genomedata is imported at the top of the module, none of the functions or methods in `signal_distibution.py` will be accessible to other modules.

Does it make sense?
content.html:
The save_plot method plots signal statistics and gmtk_parameters.py is just collecting the parameters and call utility plot functions from other modules to outputs two different plots so I think it is fair to leave save_plot in SignalStats. Also as long as genomedata is imported at the top of the module, none of the functions or methods in signal_distibution.py will be accessible to other modules.

Does it make sense?

pullrequest.title: move genomedata import to the entry point of signal_distribution

content.raw: I believe it makes sense to have the inline import here since Genomedata is *not* an explicit requirement for Segtools anyway. Genomedata is only required when calling `signal_distribution.py` from an entry point script. So it makes sense to have the import conditional on this fact.
content.html: I believe it makes sense to have the inline import here since Genomedata is not an explicit requirement for Segtools anyway. Genomedata is only required when calling signal_distribution.py from an entry point script. So it makes sense to have the import conditional on this fact.
